thread.title: A Flourless Flatbread You Can Make at Home
thread.title_full: A Flourless Flatbread You Can Make at Home

author: Jenny Sugar
title: A Flourless Flatbread You Can Make at Home
text:
A Flourless Flatbread You Can Make at Home January 27, 2017 by Jenny Sugar 231 Shares 
You may have never heard of a socca (pronounced SOH-kah), but you are going to be so glad you found this recipe. This is one of the best-tasting gluten-free flatbreads you'll ever make, but don't worry — it's super easy! It's soft, moist, and chewy, which for gluten-free foods is hard to come by. It's made from chickpea flour, which adds a subtly sweet flavor, plus it's high in protein and fiber. Related: A Clean-Eating Plan That Helps You Meal Prep 
This 170-calorie flatbread offers five grams of fiber and five grams of protein, is completely vegan, and is so versatile. You can use for a flatbread pizza , top it with hummus and veggies, or top it with sautéed fruit for a sweet treat . Heck, it even tastes great smeared with good ol' PB&J. 
The only hard part about this recipe is getting your hands on some chickpea flour, but you can just go to your local health food store and hit up the baking aisle or bulk section, or you can buy some Bob's Read Mill Garbanzo Flour from Amazon. Also note that this recipe takes a little planning ahead as the batter needs at least 30 to 60 minutes to thicken before cooking. Socca From Stephanie Clarke, RD, and Willow Jarosh, RD, of C&J Nutrition Ingredients
